97849.name: Percentage of urban population (Kuroda (1986))
97849.description: Proportion of the population classified as urban, as a share of the total population.
97849.datasetName: Urbanization and Development in Japan - Kuroda (1986)

source.name: Kuroda (1986)
source.dataPublishedBy: Kuroda et al (1986). Urbanization and Development in Japan. "Population and Development" Series No.3. The Asian Population and Development Association (foundation)
source.additionalInfo:
See Table 2 for original data. 

Urbanization estimates are taken from:
-Minami, Ryoshin, Economic Development in Japan" Toyo Keizai Shinpo, 1981, pp.216
-1980 National Census Monograph Series No.3 of the Statistics Bureau of the Prime Minister's Office, "Regional Distribution of Japanese Population and Its Changes" 1983, pp.60

97850.name: Percentage of densely inhabited districts (D.I.D) (Kuroda (1986))
97850.description:
Share of the population living in densely inhabited districts (D.I.D) which represents an urban area. To qualify as a D.I.D, a district must have a population density of 4,000 inhabitants or more, per square kilometre, and a population of 5,000 or more at the time of the Population Census of Japan. 

For further information and criteria defining densely inhabited districts see: http://www.stat.go.jp/english/data/chiri/did/1-1.html
97850.datasetName: Urbanization and Development in Japan - Kuroda (1986)
